body_html:
I understand that. But I thought that this is exactly what deprecation is
used for. By deprecating tf.slice officially you could encourage people to
not use it in new projects and replace it with tf.strided_slice in the old
ones. This way it could be eventually removed.

On Mon, 3 Oct 2016 at 11:38 Yaroslav Bulatov notifications@github.com
wrote:

@rizar https://github.com/rizar removing tf.slice would break existing
models which use it

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
I understand that. But I thought that this is exactly what deprecation is
used for. By deprecating tf.slice officially you could encourage people to
not use it in new projects and replace it with tf.strided_slice in the old
ones. This way it could be eventually removed.

On Mon, 3 Oct 2016 at 11:38 Yaroslav Bulatov notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @rizar https://github.com/rizar removing tf.slice would break existing
> models which use it
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
